mutants.code:
def longest_common_subset_length(arr: list) -> int:
    """
    Computes the length of the longest subarray that is contained in both the pre-set and end-set of the given array.

    Parameters:
    arr (list): A list of integers representing the colors.

    Returns:
    int: The length of the longest subarray that is contained in both the pre-set and end-set.
    """
    n = len(arr)
    length = 1
    lps = [0] * n
    i = 1
    while i < n:
        if arr[i] == arr[length]:
            length += 1
            lps[i] = length
            i += 1
        elif length != 0:
            length = lps[length - 1]
        else:
            lps[i] = 0
            i += 1
    return max(lps)

    """
    n = len(arr)
    length = -1
    lps = [0] * n
    i = 1
    while i < n:
        if arr[i] == arr[length]:
            length += 1
            lps[i] = length
            i += 1
        elif length != 0:
            length = lps[length - 1]
        else:
            lps[i] = 0
            i += 1
    return max(lps)

    Parameters:
    arr (list): A list of integers representing the colors.

    Returns:
    int: The length of the longest subarray that is contained in both the pre-set and end-set.
    """
    n = len(arr)
    length = 0
    lps = [0] * n
    i = 1
    while i < n:
        if arr[i] == arr[length]:
            length += 1
            lps[i] = length
            i += 1
        elif length != 0:
            length = lps[length - 1]
        else:
            lps[i] = 1
            i += 1
    return max(lps)

def longest_common_subset_length(arr: list) -> int:

    Computes the length of the longest subarray that is contained in both the pre-set and end-set of the given array.

            lps[i] = length
            i += 1
        elif length != 0:
            length = lps[length - 1]
        else:

            i += 2
    return max(lps)
